Description of incident: Seventeen of 400 databases            were tapped by hackers. Personal information may have been stolen. One            of those computers contained lab results for people tested at the campus            medical center. The servers had a database containing 37,000 records            of lab data. They contain the names, addresses, birthdates and Social            Security numbers of each person who has had lab work, such as a blood            or urine test, done on the UA campus since 1994.
